title: Let's Go on a Seaside Adventure!
location: Bar Harbor Inn 1 Newport Drive Bar Harbor, ME 04609 Show map
about: Come join authors Heidi Chiavaroli, Amanda Dykes, and Melissa Tagg as they embark on a literary excursion to celebrate Maine and you—their readers! Experience lighthouses, quaint inns, breathtaking views, yummy food, hikes, author chats, and free time to read or explore. May 15-20, 2025 We’ll start our journey in historic Boston, where you can take a tour of Beacon Hill with our authors before settling in for a reception at the Omni-Parker Hotel. Our second day, we’ll take to the road for a coastal journey to breathtaking Acadia National Park where we’ll spend three days talking books, exploring nature, eating delicious food, cozying up with campfires, and simply relaxing. We’ll end our time in Portland, enjoying more lighthouses, more history, and more author time. Each part of the trip is customizable—participate in as many or as little of the planned activities as you’d like! We can’t wait to see you! For more information contact: mindelynn@readfarandwide.com

title: Mount Auburn Cemetery Bird Walk with Peter Alden - May 10th

about: Mt. Auburn Cemetery in Watertown is well-known for the many species of migrating birds that visit this attractive habitat found in a densely populated urban area. title: Celebrate Native Plants at the Loring Greenough House!
location: Loring Greenough House 12 South Street Boston, MA 02130 Show map
about: The Loring-Greenough House will celebrate the completion of our Native Plant Border at an unveiling in May. Join us to tour the garden, support the project by 'sponsoring' a plant, and learn about the benefits of Native Plants! The bed along the south-facing border contains a robust variety of plants that are native to the eastern half of the US, bringing color, visual interest, and seasonal changes to an existing plant bed. Mostly shade-loving, this mix of perennials and shrubs, along with evergreen trees for screening, will help the public identify and become more familiar with native plants that play an important ecological role in our community. Native plants are beneficial because they are low-maintenance, require less water, and provide habitat for birds and beneficial insects. Bleeding Heart, Jacob's Ladder, and Goldenrod are just a few of the many perennials that will greet all creatures, great and small, throughout the seasons. Recently added to the border are a few trees - the beautiful Fringe tree and three Arborvitaes. Among the shrubs are Aronia, Clethra and Sweetspire. Join us on May 10th from 1:00 to 3:00 for our garden opening which includes a presentation by Shoma Haque in the parlor followed by refreshments and a tour of the native border. Join us at this celebration by buying a ticket for $10 or by sponsoring a plant! $25* Sponsors a Perennial | $50* Sponsors a Shrub | $100* Sponsors a Tree *plus donation processing fee (Both options are accessible under the "select tickets" button on the right.)

title: Birding 101 at Mount Auburn Cemetery with the Brookline Bird Club
location: Mount Auburn Cemetery 580 Mount Auburn Street Cambridge, MA 02138 Show map
about: Cambridge's Mount Auburn Cemetery in May is often astonishing—not just for the variety of birds and the eye-popping rarities, but also for the sheer numbers of migrating warblers. This walk is designed for never-before birders, beginners, birders who just getting started and birders looking to hone their listening skills and ability to pick a Tennessee Warbler out of the canopy. title: Conspiracy Scavenger Hunt in Boston
location: North Square North Square Boston, MA 02113 Show map
about: 🧩 Get ready for possibly the most exciting outdoor scavenger hunt you'll ever experience! Step in the shoes of the assistent of a real detective and try to stop a powerful secret group from taking over the world. Work together with the Detective to find hidden clues scattered in the most iconic spots in your city , decipher encripted messages and piece together the evidence to reveal the secret plans of the Kingmakers and save the humanity. This isn't your typical scavenger hunt - it's half detective story , half puzzle adventure , and 100% fun . Bring your friends and see if you can work together without suspecting each other! WHAT MAKES IT SPECIAL❓ 🔎 Search for hidden clues through some of Boston 's most iconic spots . 🦹‍♂️ Piece together the evidence to unfold the story as you go. 🧠 Challenge your brain by solving puzzles that make you feel like a real detective. 👥 C hallenge your friends to see who's the smartest in your group ( we all know it's you ). 🎓 Learn fun facts about the biggest secret societies from around the world. 📷 Capture fun & long-lasting memories and share them with everyone directly from the app.

title: Overnight Backpacking Trip for Ages 11-15
location: Russell Commons 78-92 Chestnut St Arlington, MA 02474 Show map
about: Join Tim Swanson of Owl Eyes Wilderness Survival and Dave Fatula of Guineafowl Adventure Company in this camping and backpacking experience. Students will learn the basics of overnight backpacking in the wilderness. Topics will include how to plan a trip, emergency response plans, how to pack a backpack, set up a campsite, camp cooking, route planning, and more.  Depending on group ability and interest, we may summit a mountain, explore a waterfall, stay at camp to learn skills, swim, and/or fish. The hike will require hiking up to 5 miles or more on varied elevation and terrain each day and students are required to bring most of their own gear, however, some gear is available to rent. Guineafowl Adventure Company has tents, backpacks, sleeping pads, and sleeping bags available should students need to borrow anything for the trip. Food will be provided, please inform us of any dietary restrictions, preferences, or allergies. A shuttle service will be available from Arlington, MA to the Lincoln Woods Trailhead in the White Mountains of New Hampshire. You may meet us in Arlington to drop your child off, or bring them straight to the trailhead. We will make sure everyone has the right gear before we head out on our hike. A detailed gear list will be sent to students before the trip. This is an overnight trip in the backcountry with highly trained instructors who spend a lot of their days in the wilderness. We are excited to be offering this as a course, and try to be accomodating to everyone. We ask that you are realistic in the expectations with your child in regards to physical ability, homesickness, and getting alot with other people their age. Each individual impacts the group dynamic and there is a certain expectation that everyone will respect eachother and be able to make it to the campsite. We act as a group on backcountry trips and never leave anyone behind, however we have a plan and must make it to the campsite for the night. If there are any questions or concerns, please reach out to us. This trip will start Saturday morning and end Sunday evening. Exact times will be communicated before the expedition. This course is open to students ages 11-15.
tags: Things to do in Arlington, MA

title: Epic Zombie Survival Scavenger Hunt in Boston by Zombie Scavengers
location: 1 Faneuil Hall Sq 1 Faneuil Hall Square Boston, MA 02109 Show map
about: Ready to survive? Zombie Scavengers plunges participants into a high-stakes, app-powered scavenger hunt, transforming familiar Boston city streets into a virtual, thrilling, post-apocalyptic battleground. Teams embark on a mission to survive by using their smartphone to navigate the city that is virtually turned into a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Teams must complete tricky challenges, solve riddles, and gather (take photos of) essential supplies to stave off the virtual undead horde roaming the city. Each mission the teams complete will earn them points on the app’s leaderboard where they can see how they have done compared to other surivival teams. Players must communicate and strategize as they work together to find essential items around the city that they need to survive. Zombie Scavengers is a dynamic and engaging activity that tests problem-solving skills, teamwork, and a healthy dose of survival instinct, making it a unique and memorable adventure through the streets of Boston.  Zombie Scavengers is priced per team. You can have up to 10 players per team. Each ticket gives one team access to participate in Zombie Scavengers.  After ticket purchase, Zombie Scavengers requires a redemption made on the website. Redemption can be made at https://www.zombiescavengers.com/reservations In addition to the Boston scavenger hunt, Zombie Scavengers has over 400 locations all over North America. Participants can choose where they’d like to participate when they redeem their ticket on the website. See locations at https://www.zombiescavengers.com/locations .  Locations include most major cities in the US & Canada.

title: Wonderful Winthrop Amazing Race & Tour
location: Adriana 19 Main Street Winthrop, MA 02152 Show map
about: Your creative, nontraditional scavenger hunt begins at a scenic spot that's a local favorite. You'll get your digital quest from your live and interactive remote host. Then you’ll take off on your own to experience a wide variety of carefully curated locations in town. You'll walk or drive to the various checkpoints as you interpret creative tasks, accept wacky challenges, and get outside your comfort zone! ONE TICKET PER PERSON. Both family and dog friendly, the game alternates between the indoors and outdoors, with plenty of bonus challenges too! You'll text photos and videos to your remote host, who cheers you on and assists, as you play - to document your progress. You can even interact with the locals to interpret the creative challenges. You won’t be able to avoid having fun, uncovering hidden gems and local secrets, making memories, laughing, and learning along the way! You’ll be part of the rich culture of this dynamic city! Every turn is full of surprises, so questions in advance are welcomed. Check out all 500 of our city hunts! Great for corporate groups, tourists, curious locals, bachelors(ettes), birthdays, families, friend trips, and other special groups! Ask us about our custom-designed experiences and virtual team builders too!

title: Boston Murder Mystery: Death in the Shadows
location: North Square North Square Boston, MA 02113 Show map
about: Highlights 🕵️‍♂️ Investigate a Chilling Mystery – Step into the shoes of a detective and uncover the truth behind Bella's murder. 🧩 Solve Puzzles & Follow Clues – Explore Boston’s historic streets, decipher hidden messages, and piece together the evidence. 🔎 Uncover a Deadly Secret – Explore famous landmarks and hidden corners as you piece together the truth behind Bella’s murder. 💀 Perfect for Date Night… Or a Killer Group Activity – Play with your partner, a group of friends, or even solo—just don’t end up the next victim! about: Boston 's fortune has faltered with the mysterious disappearance of the Golden Shamrock , the city's lucky charm , during the Annual Founders’ Day festival. The city has fallen into chaos: the clocks stopped , the signs fell , the bakery’s bread won’t rise , and the town’s prized fountain ( which flows green every spring ) has dried up . Legend says that when the shamrock is stolen, its power fractures into seven pieces of luck – each hidden in a different part of town , guarded by tricky puzzles, mischievous riddles, and enchanted objects. title: Boston Scavenger Hunt Escape: The Golden Shamrock
location: North Square North Square Boston, MA 02113 Show map
about: Boston 's fortune has faltered with the mysterious disappearance of the Golden Shamrock , the city's lucky charm , during the Annual Founders’ Day festival. The city has fallen into chaos: the clocks stopped , the signs fell , the bakery’s bread won’t rise , and the town’s prized fountain ( which flows green every spring ) has dried up . Legend says that when the shamrock is stolen, its power fractures into seven pieces of luck – each hidden in a different part of town , guarded by tricky puzzles, mischievous riddles, and enchanted objects. The only way to restore the balance in the city is to recover all seven pieces before sunset , reassemble the shamrock, and find out who took it… and why! HIGHLIGHTS : 🕵️‍♂️ - YOU are the detective and the phone is your only tool 🎮 - P lay alone or invite all your friends 🏎️ - Start any day, any hour 📍 - Explore 12 locations in Boston and retrieve all the seven pieces of luck 🧩 - Solve intriguing puzzles , decipher c ryptic messages and fix broken mechanisms ⌛ - You have exactly 2 hours to find the Golden Shamrock and save the city 🎟️ - Finish the game and enter the contest for a GOLDEN TICKET to all Questo events in 2025 , anywhere in the world!
